alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued October 10 at 7:31PM EDT until October 10 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...BRIEF SHALLOW COASTAL FLOODING POSSIBLE AROUND HIGH TIDE THIS THIS EVENING IN DOWNTOWN CHARLESTON... Tide levels in the Charleston Habor could briefly peak near 7.0 feet MLLW with high tide this evening. This will likely result in some brief, shallow coastal flooding in some of the normal locations throughout Downtown Charleston, including areas adjacent to Gadsden Creek. Motorists should be alert for saltwater across parts of Fishburne Street and Hagood Avenue as well along portions of Morrison Avenue and East Bay Street near Sanders-Clyde Elementary School. High tide in the Charleston Harbor will occur just after 918 PM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 10/09 PM 7.0 1.2 0.9 N/A Minor 11/10 AM 7.6 1.8 1.1 N/A Moderate 11/10 PM 6.9 1.1 1.0 N/A None 12/10 AM 7.4 1.6 1.0 N/A Minor 12/10 PM 6.3 0.5 0.9 N/A None 13/11 AM 6.9 1.1 0.6 N/A None &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
